intro: Achaeta plumosa, commonly known as the hairy tassel plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its delicate, feathery inflorescences. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs, which give it its common name. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically arranged in panicle-like clusters, and it produces lightweight seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Achaeta plumosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in moist, shady environments.
